note: Defines purity and intensity. Shows unbelievable concentration of fruit, with amazing blackberry, cassis, dark chocolate and vanilla flavors and a great tannin structure. A breathtaking wine. Best after 1998. 20,000 cases made.

Superbly made, giving the essence of Cabernet Sauvignon. Lots of cassis and earth aromas and flavors, spiced with excellent new wood; there is a classic backbone of well-integrated tannins. Best after 1999. 8,700 cases made.

A great Bordeaux that needs only time to develop. Seductive, with a superb concentration of vanilla, spice, blackberry and cherry aromas and flavors. Has an iron backbone of tannins, but it still shows class and finesse. Seems to last forever on the palate. Best after 1999. 25,000 cases made.

One of the stars in every vintage. The exciting 1989 Mouton defines class and concentration, with thick, chewy cassis, mint and berry flavors, full, silky tannins and great harmony. Best after 2000. 25,000 cases made.

A benchmark wine for Burgundy. Defines harmony and class, with layer upon layer of ripe earth and raspberry flavors and a great deal of refined new oak. Has a deep, complex, velvety finish. Best from 1998 through 2000. 1,500 cases made.

Magnificently rich, concentrated and deep. An elegant wine that serves up ripe plum, cherry and currant flavors with spice, toast, vanilla and cedar aromas. Inspiring and as good as any from Washington. Best from 1996 through 2002. 1,033 cases made.

A stylish wine, with power and grace in equal portions, offering generous currant, toast and plum flavors shaded by hints of pepper and gaminess. Beautifully balanced from start to finish, with dark cherry flavor holding on through the aftertaste. Drinkable now. A great value. 24,000 cases made.
Amazingly concentrated for a simple Chianti, this is overflowing with wild raspberry and smoke characteristics and shows a wonderful, smooth texture. Gorgeous. Drinkable now.

A wine with great mass; this is a complete fruit bomb, showing blueberry, cassis and mint flavors and tons of silky tannins. Truly amazing; better than the superb '85. Best after 1998. 35,000 cases made.
Opulent and sensational, with ripe fruit flavors that ooze from the glass. Not only does it have amazing fruit, but the tannins are equally impressive and are in near-perfect balance. Drink in 1998.

A Rolls-Royce of a wine. Explosive and opulent; perhaps as great as the '61. Big and powerful, with super-rich berry, tobacco and olive flavors and full, round, ripe tannins. Will go on for decades. Best after 1999.

Rich, warm, smooth and polished, with pretty, ripe, focused currant, herb, spice and oak flavors that are concentrated and deep. This gorgeous wine is packed with elegant flavors and has a long, complex aftertaste. Best from 1997 through 2001. 1,850 cases made.

Stellar in quality, with great concentration but also great finesse. Exuberant blackberry and tobacco aromas with hints of cedar lead to masses of fruit on the palate and full, silky tannins. One for the next century. 2,000 cases made.

We underrated Latour when tasted from the barrel. Gorgeous, with a captivating mixture of ripe berry and tobacco flavors and new wood notes. Has excellent concentration and a balance of fine tannins. Best after 1998. 17,000 cases made.
Big and meaty, with lots of fruit and full tannins, but featuring a sweetness and silkiness on the finish. A wine for aging. Best after 1998. 12,000 cases made.

A dramatic, classic wine, with a rough, youthful edge. Combines deep, rich, penetrating fruit nuances that echo classic Côte-Rôtie roasted flavors of currant, plum and earthy, leathery notes enhanced by spice and pepper. The tannins are firm and tight. C 700 cases made.

A great wine from Barbaresco's best producer. Deep, concentrated and powerful, with bare-knuckle tannins that stand up to the ripe, rich, earthy currant, chocolate, vanilla and raspberry flavors. Dense and complex, a real mouthful of wine, with a fantastic finish. Will need until 2000 at the earliest. 877 cases made.

A rising star of the region. Classically well made and sophisticated, with impressive blackberry, mint and chocolate aromas and flavors and very firm tannins on the finish. Almost like a Médoc in structure. Best after 1997. 8,000 cases made.

Like the 88, this is superbly crafted, with berry, licorice and cassis aromas and flavors and a huge alcohol and tannin structure, but its not overpowering. Shows great balance. Best after 1998. 20,000 cases made.

A big Bordeaux, with great presence on the palate and a stylish character of black pepper, raisin, earth, game and fruit flavors. Has a full tannin structure, but it's ripe and firm. Best after 1998. 7,500 cases made.

Fasten your seat belts, because this wine takes you for an exciting ride. Packed with apricot, honey and pear flavors and tobacco and cedar notes, it's smooth, subtle and velvety. Drink now through 1996. 400 cases made.

Luscious, with all the gorgeous raspberry and berry flavors you could want. Shows lovely, rich, ripe fruit. Perhaps the best ever at this underrated property. A superb value. Best after 1996. 25,000 cases made.

Ripe but focused, this has a massive structure yet manages to remain elegant. A wine to put away for decades. From an exclusive vineyard owned only by Coste-Caumartin. Drinkable 1997 to 2000. 650 cases made.

One of the best ever produced from this estate. Intense ripe cherry aromas and flavors come through in this St.-Julien that's big and alcholic, with full silky tannins. Built more like Port than wine. Best after 1998. 25,000 cases made.
What a surprise. Big and powerful, but very elegant at the same time, with lots of spice, juniper, vanilla and berry flavors and a super tannin structure. Best after 1998. 21,000 cases made.

A beast that's reverting to its old style. Giant in structure, ripping your palate apart with jammy tar and plump, overripe fruit flavors and masses of tannins. One of the most concentrated Bordeaux we have tasted in recent memory. Really needs time. Best after 1997. 22,000 cases made.

Rich, ripe and concentrated, bursting with plum, blueberry and currant aromas and flavors laced with spicy, chocolaty oak that echoes vanilla and cinnamon on the long finish. Keeps pumping out the flavor for minutes on end. A really classy mouthful; should develop and soften. Best from 1997 through 2000. 1,900 cases made.

Bold, ripe and powerful, with a solid, rich core of mineral, currant, plum and cedar flavors that are remarkably complex, smooth and polished, with fine but firm tannins. Elegant, refined and tasty to drink now, but sure to age. 9,400 cases made.

wine_full: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Martha's Vineyard
note: Deep, dense, dark and dangerous, this is a powerful wine, with distinctive flavors of currant, mint, eucalyptus and more, cascading and deepening with each sip. Turns gamy and chocolaty on the finish, suggesting this will be a polished, elegant wine by the time it reaches it peak. Best after 1997. 4,740 cases made.
Offers great depth and complexity. Has enticing coconut, honey, apple and spice aromas. Medium-bodied and dry, with super-ripe apple and coconut flavors and an intensely rich finish. Drinkable now.
Hard as a rock right now. This is tough, with tons of tannins holding down whatever is underneath, which appears to be rich fruit. Needs time; try after 1998. 18,000 cases made.
Has an extremely impressive, velvety mouth-feel, with rich chocolate, berry and cedar aromas and flavors and a long, almost sweet finish. Try after 1997. 7,000 cases made.

wine_full: Tokay Pinot Gris Alsace Cuvée Réserve
note: An excellent Tokay Pinot Gris; like a great white Burgundy. Rich, yet delicate and refined. Full-bodied and dry, with vanilla ice cream and fruit aromas. Overflowing with tropical fruit, vanilla, almond and cream flavors and a smoky finish that goes on and on. Drinkable now.
Enticing aromas of black coffee and dark chocolate lead to a full-bodied, well-integrated palate that's rich with ripe plum flavor and silky tannins. A benchmark for the vintage.

Just delicious; a lovely layering of currant, berry, vanilla and cocoa butter aromas and flavors, all resting on a silky texture that spins out the flavors on a long finish. A seductive wine to drink now through 1996. 501 cases made.

wine_full: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Estate Reserve
note: Seductive, ripe, round and generous, with a nice tension between the plump core of plum, black cherry and currant flavors and the lavish overlay of spicy, toasty oak notes. It's all smoothly integrated with soft tannins and offers plenty of flavor on the finish. Best after 1996. 3,015 cases made.

wine_full: Chardonnay Sonoma Valley Durell Vineyard Sand Hill
note: Rich, dense and young, with toasty, buttery notes over tight fruit flavors that will need a few years to develop fully. Creamy, peachy, pearlike and intense, but still a bit raw from oak; drinkable now. 2,470 cases made.
For being a blend of vineyards, this is unbelievable. Ripe, rich and firm, showing terrific breeding, with lovely, elegant, focused red berry flavors and superfine tannins. Drinkable now.

Rich, creamy and concentrated around a racy core of zingy, lemony acidity, packing in ripe pear, peach and honey aromas and flavors and hinting at hazelnut on the long finish. Jams in so much flavor it needs at least until 1997 to sort everything out, although it should be delicious anytime. 55 cases made.

Has a fantastic concoction of rich, focused Pinot Noir flavors that takes on a racy edge. Ultra-fine tannins, smooth-textured and polished but the fruit is deep, complex and persistent. An outstanding wine from a highly-rated year. Should get even better if aged. Best after 1995. 1,500 cases made.

wine_full: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Special Selection
note: Not quite the glorious wine of previous vintages, but has layer after layer of flavors, with plum, prune and black cherry and hints of spicy vanilla and chocolate. Shows remarkable clarity and a supple texture that should get silkier and smoother with age. Drinkable now, but should improve through 1997 to 2000. 1,000 cases made.

Has oodles of Champagne complexity in a creamy, smooth package. Rich, toasty, creamy and elegant, with delicious nutty flavors that linger on the finish. Enormously concentrated; shows the full benefit of long-term aging on the yeast.
Rich, ripe and redolent of butterscotch and pear, showing plenty of breadth and depth plus enough restraint to qualify as as elegant. Drink now. 75 cases made.

Beautifully crafted, elegantly balanced and remarkably focused and flavorful, with a brilliant beam of spicy currant, plum and blackberry flavors, smoothly integrated tannins and sneaky acidity that keeps the flavors coming on the long finish. Best after 1995. 2,209 cases made.

A delicious young Zin that is ripe, rich tannic and tasty, with tiers of fresh berry, raspberry and cherry flavors that zoom across the palate. Fresh and lively. A mouth-watering wine that drinks well now, but can hold. Drink now through 1997. 1,000 cases made.

Another winner from this estate. Made in a New World style, with lots of new wood, showing toasted coconut, milk chocolate and fruit aromas and flavors. Round and velvety, with lots of cedar notes on the finish. Drink now.
A wine in near perfect harmony and balance. Deeply colored, with lovely berry, violet and fruit aromas and flavors and a soft, caressing finish. A superb wine that's wonderful to drink now or hold.

Intensely rich and fruity, with smoky, buttery oak shadings that add complexity and depth to the ripe pear, spice and apple flavors. Sharply focused, long and lingering on the finish. A real beauty. Drink now through 1994. 2,900 cases made.

Bold, rich and fruity, with ripe, concentrated plum, currant and raspberry flavors that run deep. Has subtle oak shadings on the finish and well-integrated tannins that are present but not overbearing. Beautifully crafted but needs until 1995. 800 cases made.

A real zinger, combining great value and outstanding quality. Crisp and lively, with a creamy richness that lifts it out of the ordinary. Citrus, floral and pear aromas and flavors slip in and out of the spotlight, and it remains refreshing through the long finish. Drink now. 11,700 cases made.
Very appealing, perfumed and pretty, with bright, exuberant blackberry and boysenberry flavors on a bed of violets and vanilla. Has good concentration. Drink now.
The fruit jumps out of the glass, with masses of cassis, berry and earth aromas and flavors and a bounty of velvety tannins to back them up. Try after 1997. 15,000 cases made.
This beautifully balanced Bordeaux has rich berry, plum and spice flavors and silky tannins on the finish. Try after 1996. 25,000 cases made.

Starts slow, with tightly wound pear, vanilla and spice flavors, but gains velocity and depth, picking up pretty nutmeg and spice flavors on the finish. A well-crafted wine that shows richness, depth and complexity. Tight and youthful; drinkable now, or cellar through 1995. 250 cases made.
Smooth, ripe and generous, with rich, complex, polished pear, spice, hazelnut and honey notes. The fruit zooms across the palate. A stylish wine that's delicious; drinkable now. 6,500 cases made.

Bold, ripe and intense, with layers of plum, cedar, spice, anise and currant flavors that are rich, deep and concentrated. Has firm but polished tannins and a long, lingering aftertaste that keeps repeating the fruit themes. 1,600 cases made.

Powerful and complete, with depth, complexity and great balance. The black cherry and currant flavors are focused, and a kiss of sweet oak lasts through the long finish. For all its flavor, it remains light on its feet. Drinkable now. 2,000 cases made.

wine_full: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Vintage Selection
note: Rich and lively, with ripe black cherry, pepper, currant and spice flavors that are complex and concentrated, almost opulent. Is at a nice phase, but the tannins are still firm and compact. Finishes with pretty fruit flavors. Drink after 1995. 2,950 cases made.

wine_full: Pinot Noir Russian River Valley Reserve
note: Deep, dark and complex, with a pretty, concentrated core of currant, cherry, spice and oak flavors. Crisp and lively, finishing with a delicate aftertaste that echoes fruit and oak. Has wonderful balance and depth. Drink now. 154 cases made.
A gorgeous wine, brimming with plum, cedar and licorice flavors and young, fresh fruit braced by firm, spicy tannins. Perfectly proportioned, with plenty of time ahead. Drinkable now.

wine_full: Cabernet Sauvignon Sonoma Valley Artist Series
note: Lean, tight, firm, rich and deeply flavored, packed with spicy currant, plum and cherry flavors framed by spicy, buttery oak notes. While it's firmly tannic now, there's a smoothness to the texture that's a good sign, but it's much too young to drink now 2,700 cases made.

wine_full: Riesling Alsace Grand Cru Turckheim Brand
note: An electrifying wine, with super-charged flavors. Smooth and superb, with great acidity and ripe fruit flavors. Drink now.

wine_full: Tokay Pinot Gris Alsace Jubilée Réserve Personnelle
note: An exotic style of wine, with the power of a top white Burgundy. Concentrated aromas of tangerine and coconut; full-bodied and dry, with super-rich fruit flavors and a long, balanced finish of acidity. Very harmonious. Drink now.
Maturing, but still monumental, this is rich with honey, vanilla, pear and melon flavors and still has a long life ahead of it.

wine_full: Johannisberg Riesling Napa Valley Edelwein Gold
note: One of the most collectible sweet wines from California. Ripe, buttery, rich and sweet, with all kinds of spice, honey and butter notes gracing the core of sweet pineapple, fig and pear flavors. Tempting to drink now, but could improve through 1996. 2,500 cases made.
Pulls out all the stops. Ripe, buttery aromas and rich butterscotch flavors add up to a lush, soft wine that makes a bold style statement. Honey and peach notes lie beneath the overlay of oak aging.

A new white wine from the famous Pauillac estate. Flavorful, soft and generous, with herbal, earthy aromas turning toward spice and vanilla on the palate. Plush and strongly oak-accented, with solid pear and cream flavors at the center. Drink now. 2,400 cases made.
Displays stunning balance in a village wine, with alluring violet, berry and chocolate flavors, fine tannins and a long, delicious finish. Drinkable now.

Ripe and bold, with generous blackberry, plum and slightly pruny, spicy aromas and flavors that seem to jump out of the glass. Supple and bursting with character. Drink now through 1996. 1,000 cases made.
A blockbuster, with masses of plum, tar and berry aromas and flavors. Coats your palate with fruit and tannins. Drink now.

wine_full: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Saunders Vineyard
note: Ripe and inviting, a firm-backboned, creamy-textured, oak-scented masterpiece, offering opulent raspberry, cherry, vanilla and spice flavors and nice hints of pepper and butter on the long finish. Drink now. 150 cases made.

A beautifully harmonious wine, with intense fruit flavors that blend seamlessly with accents of spicy oak. Velvety in texture, moderately tannic and long on the finish. The cherry and plum flavors have finesse. Drinkable now but should continue to develop through 1997. 400 cases made.

Lots of flavor and a delicate texture add up to a wine with finesse and elegance. Floral, pear and hazelnut aromas and flavors are immediately attractive, with richness to burn. Spicy fruit notes emerge on the finish. Drink now. 1,000 cases made.

wine_full: Cabernet Sauvignon Maipo Valley Puente Alto Vineyard Don Melchor Private Reserve
note: Powerful and intense, pouring on the spice, with smoke, tobacco and cedar aromas backed by rich, ripe plum, prune and pepper flavors. A real mouthful, graced with chocolate and spice notes. Full-bodied and long on the finish. Perhaps Chile's best red wine. Drink now through 1995. 4,000 cases imported.

A very exotic wine that emphasizes the nutmeg and vanilla flavors of oak aging and backs it up with buttery pear accents. Soft and delicate in texture, but full in flavor, with complexities that develop on the finish. 16,500 cases made.

Full, rich and generous, with complex currant, chocolate and herb aromas and flavors shaded by sweet oak. A lively wine, with deep flavors and pretty spice notes on the finish. The tannins are present but not intrusive. Drinkable now. 6,000 cases made.

A ripe, buttery wine that's deeply colored and deeply flavorful. The solid core of pineapple and pear flavor is shaded by hints of nutmeg, caramel and vanilla notes. A broad style that already shows finesse. Drink now. 3,500 cases made.

Firm, focused and flavorful, offering distinctive spice and mint-tinged Cabernet characteristics, lots of currant and plum flavors and more richness, depth and concentration than most '89s. Oak seasoning adds a nice dimension, and the tannins are sufficient to warrant cellaring through 1995 to '98. 23,000 cases made.

wine_full: Cabernet Sauvignon Northern Sonoma Alexander's Crown Vineyard
note: Smooth and generous, with layers of ripe currant, blackberry and buttery oak flavors. Finishes with a sense of polish and elegance. Almost drinkable now, and has the intensity to improve through 1997 to 2000. 6,000 cases made.

Would give most Sauternes a run for their money. The salty, nutty, tobaccolike aromas and rich, ripe flavors are full and satisfying. Sweet, unctuous and long on the finish. Mature now and ready to drink. 2,262 cases made.

Crisp and focused, with sharply defined peach, pear and spice aromas and flavors, hinting at toast and butter on the long finish. The structure is tight, suggesting this will improve with cellaring. Drink now through 1995. 21,000 cases made.

wine_full: Chardonnay Willamette Valley Barrel Selected Private Reserve
note: Crisp at the center, but nicely rounded and polished around the edges, featuring toasty hazelnut, pear and honey aromas and flavors that extend into a long finish. Reminiscent of a good Puligny-Montrachet. Has style and grace. 700 cases made.

Firm and fleshy, with generous currant, berry and plum flavors shaded by toasty oak and a nice streak of earthy gaminess that gives it a unique and appealing character. Has style and intensity, plus enough tannin to wait until 1996 to '99 in the cellar. 15,000 cases made.
Tart, flavorful and spicy, with a generous, focused beam of juicy berry and currant flavors and a touch of oak on the finish, ending up smooth and balanced. Drinkable now.

Rich, balanced and deep, with great harmony. At this stage you taste a lot of new oak, but the generous vanilla, violet and toast notes complement the rich plum and black currant flavors. Best after 1995.
Bold and intense, with rich, lively pear, peach, honey and citrus flavors that are fresh and lively. Complex and concentrated, showing a burst of fruit on the finish. Drinkable now. 1,000 cases made.

One of Australia's finest red wines. Extremely ripe in flavor and plush in texture, with a great combination of fruit, spice, chocolate and tobacco. Complex, intense and satisfying, showing enough oak. Resembles a Côte-Rôtie. Tempting to drink now, but s 2,000 cases made.

Intense and concentrated, with sharply focused cherry, raspberry, anise and rose petal flavors that are deep and complex. The tannins and acidity taste raw. Very tightly wound. Cellar until 1999 for best results. 2,000 cases made.

Ripe, rich and complex, with deep currant, earth, oak and spice flavors that are finely woven together. The tannins are firm and rugged and clamp down on the finish. Best after 1997. 8,500 cases made.

Creamy, elegant and stylish, offering complex layers of pear, spice, honey and vanilla flavors that are smooth and polished, finishing with a long, complex aftertaste. Subtle and refined; a treat to drink.
Crisp and clean, with sharply focused pear, citrus, hazelnut and apple flavors that turn smooth, complex and creamy on the finish. Has delicacy and character. Drinkable now. 2,000 cases made.

Round and ripe, with a fine line of sweet currant and plum aromas and flavors running through it from the first sip to the long finish. Beautifully crafted fruit flavors are immediately appealing, and the texture is plush and smooth. A real winner. Taste 750 cases made.

An intensely flavorful, full-bodied, Alsatian-style wine, with layers of heady fruit, spice and mineral flavors that linger on the long finish. Dry in sugar, but rich in fruit and body, this is smooth in texture and very distinctive. 1,600 cases made.
A classy, finely crafted wine, offering lovely raspberry, berry and leaf aromas and flavors and a long, silky finish. Drink now. From Farina Stefano. 25,000 cases made.
Extremely focused, with multidimensional fruit and earth aromas and flavors and a lovely, silky mouth-feel. Drink now. 10,000 cases made.
A very concentrated, classic Sauvignon Blanc, with intense, crisp fruit and herb flavors that linger a long time on the finish. Has great balance and depth. Drink now. 8,000 cases made.

wine_full: Fumé Blanc Barrell-Fermented Reserve Alexander Valley
note: Stands out from the pack. A rich-tasting, rich-textured Fumé Blanc, with butter and vanilla overtones to the citrus and pear flavors. Has depth, elegance and a long finish. 24,000 cases made.

Firm and focused, with a nice balance of ripe plum, currant and berry flavors against spicy, toasty notes on the long, concentrated finish. Has the intensity and harmony to develop nicely through 1995 to '97. Reasonably priced, too. 11,000 cases made.

Shows uncommon balance, proportion and finesse, offering lovely currant, cherry, chocolate and smoky oak flavors that are complex and luscious. The finish is long and complex, with soft but firm tannins. Tasty now, but can age through 1998. 8,000 cases made.

Complex and intriguing for its band of flavors, offering lots of smoky raspberry, cherry, earth and tar notes that give dimension to the cola and oak shadings. Intense and lively, yet smooth in texture, finishing with a rich core of fruit flavor and a decadent edge that adds to the wine's interest. Drink now. 4,000 cases made.
